The Cumberland – A Marble Arch Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1460 reviews

Well located for shopping and tourism but the rooms were very small and the housekeeping below expectations.

When you enter the foyer it is impressively large (too large) but the room is far to small and really outdated - looks like IKEA furnished the rooms! Storage was totally inadequate for anyone with more that a small suitcase and the chair space between the desk and bed was so tight you could not turn around - not to mention the mattress was so soft that I woke with back pain! When asked for a new mattress, they brought a board and said that this will take care of the problem - it didn't. I could complain about much more but suffice to say I will not stay here again.

Show more
Walter , United States
Corus Hotel Hyde Park
7.7 Very good
Based on 1051 reviews

The receptionist knew we were travelling with a baby and offered an upgrade but with a top up . I find this pretty ridiculous.

Seems to me more that they wanted me to pay more than caring for my comfort. We chose not to upgrade our standard room. We were given a room with steps down to our room. It was very inconvenient as we had a stroller with us. There were other rooms with no steps at all. The room was an ok size but the fittings were old and not well maintained. The bed frame was so worn out and the curtains look dirty. At least the bathroom was clean. What I find really unfriendly was the entrance to the hotel. It has a ramp for wheelchairs and strollers at the side door but the side door was closed . They did not even bother to move the ramp to the main entrance. It was really inconvenient for guests with luggages and stroller. For the same price, we could have gotten better rooms elsewhere.

Show more
Hui , Singapore
La Suite West – Hyde Park
8.2 Excellent
Based on 514 reviews

Simply one of the best hotel in London. The rooms are great. The bed is big and comfortable, the pillows and the bed sheets are clean and comfortable.

The lighting is perfect, the bathroom has heated floor, and the room temperature is just perfect. The only problem is that sometimes the card key have problem, but the receptionist could sort it out quickly. The location is very good, almost perfect. It's near to Hyde Park, near two tube station Queensway and Bayswater, and located near lots of foods and groceries. The room is also spacious, well-lit (using touch control lighting) and very clean. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. We have tons of requests but they help us in all of them. They show us the best way to visit the city, show the route to the coach station, and many more.

Show more
Daniel , Indonesia
The Leonard Hotel - Marble Arch
8.3 Excellent
Based on 268 reviews

This is a lovely Edwardian style hotel 2 roads back from Oxford Street. Primark, New Look and Next are nearest shops 2 mins away round corner.

Selfridges and M&S another minute further... Hyde Park 5 mins. Interior period features and period decoration. Everything slightly dog-eared but they are starting renovations on 5th (top) floor apparently. Food pricey - Continental breakfast in room £10.50 per head for coffee, juice, cereal, toast and fruit. Wifi in room £9.50 / 24hrs unlimited and not bad speed - you may need to get near door of your room for best signal. Rooom 46 is one bed suite = double room and lounge with sofa bed (pretty thin mattress). Staff very friendly and helpful, would use again.

Show more
TIM , United Kingdom
The Scotsman Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 339 reviews

This is a really gorgeous hotel. Exterior, interior, guest rooms - everything. We only stayed one night, and checked in late, which was a pity because the room itself was so grand I wish I'd had more time to sit in the living room (it was a junior suite), drink a coffee and watch TV or read.

.. incidentally the junior suite wasn't crazily expensive. Our rooms didn't include breakfast so we didn't eat any meals in the hotel. The other notable feature of the hotel was really superb gym and spa - we arrived early in the morning and couldn't check in but they let us use the spa to shower and change. We were then out the whole day finally got to check in at night - the next morning we went back to the spa to use the gym and it was amazing - a very complete gym with everything - weights, barbells, dumbbells, cardio... the works. Nice looking pool that we didn't get to try. Staff was amazing - wonderful concierge who was very helpful and knowledgeable. On our next trip to Edinburgh I want to stay here for at least 3-4 days so we can enjoy the hotel better.

Show more
Duraiswami , India
St Giles London – A St Giles Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 1540 reviews

At first I was surprised that the hotel does not have air-con,but it turned out that with slightly opened window,the room was very cold and airy.

It is a clean basic hotel very close to Tottenham Court train station and oxford st. For those looking for Sunday Service, there is Hillsong Church at a theatre just a few meters from the hotel (before the station). Just a handy tip for travellers with heavy luggages travelling on train to/from Kingcross/St Pancras or Heathrow Airport, take the exchange for Piccadily Line at Holborn Station (instead of Leicester Square Station) as Holborn Stn has a lot less stairs compared to Leicester Station where changing platforms involves endless stairs (a nightmare for heavy luggages).

Show more
Rosalina , Indonesia
Central Park Hotel
6.9 Good
Based on 723 reviews

Looks like this is the best hotels in the area. Very simple to get food any point of day and even supper.

Quiet neighbourhood and not touristy like the next street which is noisy and lots of people around. London Tube is about 5-7 mins walk and busses are very convenient as well about 2-3 mins walk. Very easy to go shopping destinations like Primark and Selfridges. Harrods is a little further away as well as sight seeing destinations. The room is really small and a small electronic fan was provided to circulate the room air. Very basic hotel nothing much to expect other than a warm shower and a good night sleep. Check in timing is a little too late and checking out is even earlier. Able to store your bags in the basement before check in and after check out for convenience.

Show more
Alex , Singapore
Shangri-La Hotel At The Shard
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 138 reviews

My family and I stayed at the Shangri-La for one night to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. It is a lovely hotel but expensive! We had breakfast in the Ting Restaurant which was nice, nothing special.

What we paid for was the 'view'. The hotel room was a superior standard room, was very comfortable. Bathroom very nice, heated floor and heated toilet seat - bliss! On the day we were there, it was a very warm day and we could not get the temperature right. It was very warm in the room, even with the fan on and the temperature at the lowest it would go. The bed was very comfortable. I paid for an extra bed for my daughter to sleep in which she said was so comfortable. We used the swimming pool which was nice, great view from the 52nd floor. We enjoyed our stay and if we could afford it, would stay here again, but it's very pricey so cannot justify spending that kind of money again. It was a memorable stay and my husband enjoyed spending his 50th birthday at the Shangri-La.

Show more
Maria , United Kingdom
Ace Hotel London Shoreditch
8.5 Excellent
Based on 271 reviews

Albeit on the expensive side, Ace hotel was fantastic. I loved how it complements the area of Shoreditch / east London and how the hotel lobby was always buzzing with energy and life.

The hotel rooms are minimalist and of a raw and industrial decor but it was nevertheless comfortable and luxurious. The bed was huge and comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, bright and clean. As I was traveling for work, I also loved that the room had a proper round table and chair for work and ample power sockets. As I was staying with ace for a week, the staff at the front desk have me a complimentary upgrade which I felt was a lovely gesture for a new hotel like ace. It was very appreciated!

Show more
Elmer , Singapore
Royal Garden Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 256 reviews

I stayed here for a busy 3 day weekend, during which we did not spend an awful lot of time at the hotel so I cannot comment on the hotel amneties, although I have heard that the restaurants are excellent, and the in house dining menu looked reasonably priced and extensive.

The location of this hotel is excellent, on the corner of kensignton gardens and with all of the shops restaurants and bard of hoigh street kensington on your doorstop. Great central location for shopping and sightseeing. We were very pleased with the quality of our room, it was spacious (for london), very comfortable and absolutely spotless with a lovely spacious bathroom. All in a pleasing modern design. It offered us all of the comfort and convenience we were looking for in our stay and the staff were most accomodating by allowing us an ear;y check-in. Would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel.

Show more
Naomi , United Kingdom
Strand Palace Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 908 reviews

The room was mediocre in that the wardrobe was too narrow to hang coats and suits in it. We couldn't close the door! The shelves were OK for storing clothes but I prefer a dresser.

We had to ask for an iron and board. Those are usually standard. The room did not come with a refrigerator. The bed was as hard as a rock and the pillows, though many, were flat. The sink area was so small that placing a tooth brush was impossible. There was only on towel bar and although it was a double it was hung above the toilet so you couldn't hang towels on it without affecting the shelf where the toiletries were stored for use. There was a whole wall without any bars on it. There was't a towel bar beside the sink to hang a hand towel.

Show more
Mark , United States
The Z Hotel Piccadilly
8.6 Excellent
Based on 436 reviews

The room was so tiny that during the night you felt you couldnt breathe. The only elevator they had was out of service from Saturday to monday and we had to take the stairs every day to the forth floor and the least we expected was an apology from someone that of course we didn't get.

no phone inside the room to contact the reception and without the elevator if you needed something you had no help from the hotel.really disappointed.And the price sure isn't right for this kind of service.

Show more
aikaterini , Greece
The Z Hotel Victoria
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1353 reviews

I booked one of the inside rooms with no windows at this hotel because I needed a place to stay for one night before moving on to stay with a friend.

It was just wonderful! I didn't have high expectations having booked a windowless room, but it was just what I needed. A great spot to sleep off some jetlag, for sure. The room was very small but nice and modern and well kitted-out. Very comfortable bed and pillows and the shower was great. The parts I didn't expect - when I arrived I was offered a glass of lemon iced tea, which was just so refreshing and then the staff tell me that between 5pm and 8pm there is a wine and cheese buffet for guests - for free! It was really fantastic and a nice setting to meet other solo travellers. The location is fabulous being so close to Victoria train station and within very close walking distance of Buckingham Palace, gardens and down towards Big Ben etc. would definitely stay again.

Show more
Melissa , Australia
Radisson Blu Portman Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 145 reviews

Chose this one as we got a fairly good offer for a ok plus hotel centrally located for our NYE celebration and shopping.

Ok size of room, taken into consideration the usual size of London hotel rooms. Helpful and nice staff. Rooms could have needed a little refurbishment, standard was not what you would have expected from a hotel of this price. Plus for free wifi. Minus for the fact that when we asked to remove some items from the minibar so that we could keep some of our own stuff there without beeing charged for it, they allowed us to and then just unplugged the fridge.

Show more
Henrik , Norway
The Athenaeum Hotel & Residences
8.5 Excellent
Based on 88 reviews

The hotel and the staff were extremely friendly and courteous and the hotel is very well situated in a nice part of London.

My family and I enjoyed our stay very much. The double rooms in the adjacent hotel-apts gave us extra room and put us on a quiet side street. The room had the feel of an apt as much as a hotel room. The only issues were minor ones (TV not working properly,some common areas looking a little worn or dingy). My wife and children were very pleased with the free snack, sodas, cocktail hour on Wednesday evening. I would definitely stay there again.

Show more
Brian , United States
Amba Hotel Marble Arch
8 Very good
Based on 657 reviews

We left the luggage with concierge before check in, as we are in hurray to a meeting, we asked the reception if we can just take our own luggages to the room rather than waiting to be sent to our room.

The receptionist being so helpful and ran down to concierge himself and brought us the luggages. The only down side is concierge offers to book taxi for us to Heathrow at £60 while we only paid £33 when we booked online by ourself within 12 hours before our flight. Of course concierge will make profit from their service but seems charge a lot!

Show more
Hoi , United Kingdom
Park Plaza Westminster Bridge Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 432 reviews

Our stay was disappointing and short of our expectation given the price. When we booked our room, we were not aware that the room had disabled facilities.

As it was our honeymoon, the disabled facilities made the experience far from romantic. The room itself was however spacious and the bed comfortable. We did try and change rooms but was told that all rooms with a window had disabled facilities. We ended up staying with the same room in lieu of an alternative room with 4 walls (no window at all). The restaurant Ichi at the hotel was shocking. We ordered a few dishes but the most memorable ones was the salmon carpaccio, which came out cooked rather than raw and the beef carpaccio, which we had to return to the kitchen because it looked chewed up meat, not to mention it was way too chunky for a carpaccio. It clearly look like off cuts that butchered by a blunt knife. We do recognise that the restaurant did not end up charging us for the beef carpaccio.

Show more
Christine , Australia
The Tower Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 475 reviews

We would totally recommend The Tower Hotel. From the lovely warm reception from Jose at the Check Inn desk to the room service staff and not forgetting the dining staff who could not do enough for our daughter when we arrived late for breakfast and she was hungry.

Very much appreciated, thank you! We were totally impressed from the very first moment...friendly helpful doorman, lovely foyer and it smelled beautiful! Rooms were spacious and very comfortable and we were blown away with the VIEW. We arrived after dark and saw Tower Bridge and surrounding places of interest in all it's glory. It was magnificent! We will definitely stay again!

Show more
Simon , United Kingdom
Point A Hotel London Kings Cross - St. Pancras
7.6 Very good
Based on 1353 reviews

I've stayed there for 2 days. The location is good because there's a supermarket and a café just in front of the hotel, a bank nearby, and you can reach the King's Cross station (very well linked to other lines) walking for 5 minutes.

The staff is very kind, polite and glad to help you. Rooms are not big but clean. The mattress is not very comfortable. It is possible buying tea, coffee or water at the reception which is opened 24h. In addition there's the possibility to leave your baggages at the hotel the day of your check out paying just £2.50 per person. Good value for money. I really recommend it! Thank you Tune Hotel!

Show more
Valentina , Italy
Point A Hotel London Shoreditch
8.5 Excellent
Based on 105 reviews

Its located quite close to the tube which is a definite plus, and so the only thing that bought down the rating was the fact that on the first day of my 6-day stay they informed me that the cleaning team would come in ever 2 days.

This made it uncomfortable as the rooms are perfect for 2 travellers on business but its not very spacious (its exactly as per their pictures)- so it can get untidy 2 days later the cleaning crew hadn't turned up when we returned - but the staff were really wonderful and made sure the cleaning team returned the next day. However when the cleaning day came up once again i returned to my room in disarray -the cleaning team had failed to arrive once again. thumbs up to the great staff and facilities over all.

Show more
Thrinethri , Sri Lanka
Hilton London Metropole Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 536 reviews

I chose this Hilton for a nice getaway with my gf. The location could not have been worse for a Hilton in my opinion.

The road that you have to take towards Oxford street is filled with shisha bars and pawn shops unless you smoke shisha, you can only sit outside for 15 minutes. For breakfast I would recommend to walk towards the Cinema at the end of the street, towards Marble Arch. A lot cheaper and tastes a lot better than the buffet at the Hotel (for pp I would think the Bacon would not taste this funky. If you want to stay close by I would recommend

Show more
Kevin , Netherlands
Best Western Maitrise Hotel Maida Vale
7.5 Very good
Based on 289 reviews

We were firstly given a double instead of a kingside,tiny room and bathroom, this was then promptly rectified.

The new room was in an extended part, we think, stairs up, down, up, like faulty towers. On one staircase, the light only came on as you reached the top, dangerous! Bathroom was of a terrible design, sink splashed water everywhere, the showers; ceiling mounted and hand held over bath with small shower screen soaked the whole bathroom, despite us being so careful that we were unable to enjoy a shower. The radiator situated next to the toilet, was so hot it scalded us. The bathroom floor had hairs on it and the bathroom door was unclean. The whole place was hot and stuffy, if you opened the windows, the external noise disturbed, turning the room thermostat down did not seem to make a difference. Breakfast was continental only, with option to pay for cooked. Overall disappointed.

Show more
Yashmin , United Kingdom
Park International Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 726 reviews

Loving this Hotel very much..cleanliness is upmost inportant to me and they are extremely clean and i have no doubt about that!! Staff very helpful and friendly.

.i didn't use the facilities at all so i didn't know how they are like but im sure they are the best too..Location-wise is very good as i am staying at this hotel due to the nearest tube (Glouster road) is very reachable within few minutes and connected to Heathrow terminal 4..so i like it a lot in terms of Location..Everything is excellent with Park International Hotel and i would love to stay here again and recommend to anyone who wanted to stay for vacation or business trip..

Show more
Md , Brunei Darussalam
The Z Hotel Soho
8 Very good
Based on 479 reviews

Fine, had expected small rooms from earlier reviews and we were upgraded to a slightly bigger room which meant enough space for our 1 night stay.

Modern decor, cosy comfy bed fitted into one end of the room with Full Sky TV at the end of the bed. The only issue really was the bathroom which was quite modern and appeared well designed (except for the small wash basin and limited space to leave toiletries), however, the problem was the shower. It was broken and had not been properly maintained meaning you had to hold it carefully with one hand to get any flow - this didnt really work or allow you to wash properly. Worse still was the fact it then didnt drain and covered the whole bathroom floor including draining into the bedroom. This did not resolve overnight so all-in-all it soured what would otherwise had been an acceptable stay for the price.

Show more
Tim , United Kingdom
Hotel Cafe Royal
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 60 reviews

Best hotel in London! The location is amazing. The staff are super helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to accomodate all our needs and more.

The rooms are beautiful and modern, spacious and clean, with beautiful views of Regent street. The breakfast was great. I will recommend this hotel to anyone 100%. Hopefully I'll get a chance to go back.

Show more
Shaazia , South Africa
Royal Lancaster London
8.2 Excellent
Based on 602 reviews

Tiny Shower in the bath - not very wide. Noisy cleaners every morning at 7:30 going room to room. I think they were looking for tips left.

This meant doors banging closed every 20 seconds as they went in and out of every possible room. Falsely advertised satellite / cable tv but only had 2 poor quality channels. I wouldnt have stayed here had i have known. I'm a massive motorsport fan so at 4am i had to venture down Edgewere road to a casino. Front desk staff were very polite and friendly, the concierge staff not so. Great location though.

Show more
Travis , Australia
Sanctum Soho Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 167 reviews

Sanctum Soho is a great place to stay for a trip to the West End. There's a Rock'n'Roll theme throughout, from the music played in the bar and the very stylish decor, down to the magazines in the rooms.

It's dark and lush and unashamedly cool but above all always friendly and welcoming. We stayed in one of the upstairs suites, which was roomy, quiet and very clean. The service was friendly and attentive beyond the call of duty. The location is also a big plus, being just off Regent Street and only a 5 minute walk to Piccadilly Circus and Oxford Street and 10-15 minutes to Leicester Square and Chinatown. We will certainly be back in the future. Highly recommended!

Show more
Johanna , Germany
Bayswater Inn Hotel
6.4 Good
Based on 468 reviews

features advertised were not available - no in-room safe, no laundry, took two requests to have bathroom fan repaired, hand and bath towel supplied but no washcloth ???, two days into stay unmentioned renos were started right above our room ( very loud and early), balcony doors were not very secure and no screen for door when it is open for fresh air ( bugs ), there was no air cond.

, price point was reasonable and location OK if you don't mind walking to all amenities, you get what you pay for, if price point is important and few luxuries are required, this is for you

Show more
Dana , Canada
Old Town Chambers
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 313 reviews

We spent 3 days in Edinburgh at the end of a long trip with a 1 and 3 year old. If I knew about Old Town Chambers ahead of time I would have stayed a week.

The location, in a close next to Angels With Bagpipes off the high street (Royal Mile) put us in easy walking distance of everything in Old Town (3 blocks from Edinburgh Castle, 3 staircases from Waverley Station, directly across the street from St. Giles...). We had a stove, dishwasher and clothes washing machine in the clean, modern unit, A king bed in one room, two beds pushed together into a king in the other. As a very nice touch, there was a new pint of milk in the otherwise empty refrigerator when we checked in, perfect for our coffee. Our children are very mobile and loved the stairs down the close and the narrow passageways to get to the Chambers; I wouldn't recommend it for people with bad knees, mobility problems, or really heavy suitcases. For the rest of us, this place is excellent.
